meanings.definition: A person who convenes or organizes a meeting or event.
meanings.sent1: The convenors of the book club scheduled the next meeting for Friday.
meanings.sent2: The school convenors arranged a fun field trip for the students.
meanings.sent3: The convenors of the picnic forgot to bring the food, so it turned into a game of 'find the snacks'.
meanings.sent4: As the convenors of the project, they were the architects of its success.
meanings.sent5: The convenors' efficient planning made the event a memorable experience for all.

meanings.definition: The group or committee responsible for organizing and overseeing a meeting or event.
meanings.sent1: The convenors met to discuss the agenda for the upcoming conference.
meanings.sent2: The convenors worked together to ensure everything ran smoothly during the event.
meanings.sent3: The convenors of the party committee accidentally planned two parties on the same day.
meanings.sent4: The convenors of the charity event were the driving force behind its success.
meanings.sent5: The convenors' dedication and teamwork were evident in the flawless execution of the event.
